data.title: Shifty Strings
data.solution:
import sys
import math

# Auto-generated code below aims at helping you parse
# the standard input according to the problem statement.

L=input()
i = len(L)
while i>=0:
    k=L[i:] +L[:i]
    print (k)
    if k==L and i!= len(L):
       break
    i-=1
data.statement:
Given a string, print out every single time the string can be shifted until it reverts to the original string (the end character goes to the front).

For example:
Input: {{"abcde"}}
Output:
abcde
bcdea
cdeab
deabc
eabcd
abcde

data.outputDescription:
Line 1: [[L]]
Line 2: [[L]] shifted down 1 letter (the end character shifts to the front).
Line N: [[L]] shifted down N letters.
... until 
Line N + 1:  The same as [[L]]

lastVersion.statementHTML:
The program:
Given a string, print out every single time the string can be shifted until it reverts to the original string (the end character goes to the front).

For example:
Input: "abcde"
Output:
abcde
bcdea
cdeab
deabc
eabcd
abcde
INPUT:
Line 1: A string L

OUTPUT:
Line 1: L
Line 2: L shifted down 1 letter (the end character shifts to the front).
Line N: L shifted down N letters.
... until
Line N + 1: The same as L

CONSTRAINTS:
1 < Length of L

EXAMPLE:
Input
Codingame
Output
Codingame
eCodingam
meCodinga
ameCoding
gameCodin
ngameCodi
ingameCod
dingameCo
odingameC
Codingame
